thread.title: Woman finds hilarious Waitrose shopping list with a VERY specific set of instructions
thread.title_full: Woman finds hilarious Waitrose shopping list with a VERY specific set of instructions

author: hrichardson
title: Woman finds hilarious Waitrose shopping list with a VERY specific set of instructions
text:
'Heston prawn cocktail - but no other' Woman finds hilarious Waitrose shopping list with a VERY specific set of instructions 
Poppy Horsman made the amusing discovery, which asked for Duchy Originals organic carrots for the household, but value carrots 'for the horses', in Norfolk WTF Click to share on Facebook (Opens in new window) Comments IT’S fair to say that Waitrose has a reputation for offering one of the UK’s more upmarket grocery shopping experiences. 
Former Prime Minister David Cameron is a regular, as he reckons its customers are particularly “talkative, engaged people”. EPA 2 Waitrose has a reputation of providing a more ‘upmarket’ shopping experience 
Judging by this shopping list, they’re also incredibly picky – when it comes to carrots and prawn cocktail, that is. 
Customer Poppy Horsman, a youth worker, came across this hilarious note discarded in a trolley while in the Swaffham branch of the store in Norfolk with her mum Jill. 
And it certainly gives us an amusing insight into how the other half shop. 
The list asks for two packs of Duchy Organic Carrots – Prince Charles’ favourite, apparently – plus one bag of value carrots – for the horses . Instagram/Poppyella_ Poppy Horsman, a youth worker, came across this hilarious note discarded in a trolley while in the Swaffham branch of the store in Norfolk with her mum Jill 
It also lists prawn cocktail, stipulating it must only be Heston Blumenthal –“no other”. 
Other contents include fresh ginger, spinach “if available” – presumably a nod to the current veg crisis across Europe , and ‘Badoit’ sparkling water – which retails at 90p a litre. 
Semi-skimmed milk, Basmati rice and mixed nuts were also among the list of requirements. 
But when it came to chocolate, it seemed the shopper wasn’t fussed what brand or variety. Related Stories Waitrose rebrands 'British' ready meals... because lamb in them actually comes from New Zealand CORKING SELECTION Aldi named best store to buy wine for THIRD year running beating rivals Waitrose and Morrisons TROLLEY TROUBLE Waitrose to axe nearly 700 staff and close at least five stores in huge shake-up Making a meal of it Frugal mum feeds her family for just THREE POUNDS a day after shopping for groceries online and at Waitrose... and the meals really do look delicious SHOP TILL YOU TROT Bizarre moment woman attempts to enter Waitrose supermarket while on her horse 
Poppy told Mirror Online : “Me and my mum thought it was so funny. 
“We couldn’t find any of Heston’s prawn cocktail sauce to try which was disappointing. 
“We thought it was funny how they were so specific with their sparkling water choice but any old chocolate will do.”
